text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with orange cumin vinaigrette
that's right i'm going to show you how
to make this very tasty salad dressing
that was featured in our raquel salad
but really i was just looking for an
excuse to show you the old making shake
salad dressing method that requires no
whisking no drizzling no machinery of
any kind and it really does work
fantastically so here is how you do it
so first up you're going to need some
kind of jar with a screw-on lid I find
these eight ounce mason jars the optimal
size so that's why I'm going to use here
like I said we're going to do an orange
cumin vinaigrette and it starts with
some Dijon mustard a whole bunch of
freshly grated orange zest only the
orange no white please and then a nice
big spoon of freshly ground cumin and
that was a little bit of red pepper it's
a pepper called Aleppo pepper but any
kind of pepper will work here I'm also
going to put in a little splash of fresh
orange juice not too much and then some
rice wine vinegar which is very mild on
the sweeter side and then it's time to
add our oil and one of the beauties of
this method besides the easy mixing is
that you're able to see the ratio
between your vinegar and your oil so
we're going to go ahead and pour in our
oil just takes a second to settle so
you'll see I have one part vinegar to
one and a half parts oil all right
sometimes I do two to one sometimes I do
three to one depends but this way I can
actually see it without measuring and
then last but certainly not least do not
forget to season your dressings alright
they always are going to need a pinch of
salt and possibly a pinch of pepper
depending on your mood that's a rookie
mistake not to add at least a little
salt
alright at that point we're going to
screw on the top nice and tight and then
give it a shake a vigorous vigorous
shake for several minutes and what
you're going to form is something called
a temporary emulsification and all that
means is the vinegar is suspended into
that oil and it will remain that way
plenty long enough for you to dress a
salad that'll price day multiplied at
least a half hour
okay the longer and harder you shake it
the longer it will stay emulsified but
if you think about all we're going to do
is dress the salad and then eat so
really that's not a big concern so
anyway there you go a quick and easy
vinaigrette recipe it's come to my
attention that some of you are eating
the same salad dressing every time which
is really not recommended you got to
shake things up
easiest pun ever and as you may have
already heard me say this was incredibly
delicious on this raw kale salad this
really really tasty fresh vibrant fruity
really nice and then of course above and
beyond a tasty salad dressing I really
really wanted to show you the old making
shake salad dressing method really does
work wonderfully so easy so I really
hope you give that a try and I really
hope you give this a try so head over to

amounts and more info as usual and as
